name: Ray Phiri
description:
'''Raymond Chikapa Enock Phiri''' (23 March 1947 â€“ 12 July 2017) was a South African [[South African jazz|jazz]], [[jazz fusion|fusion]] and [[mbaqanga]] musician{{sfn|Mojapelo|2008|p=136}} born in [[Mpumalanga]] to Thabethe Phiri, a Malawian immigrant worker, and South African guitarist nicknamed "Just Now" Phiri. He was a founding member of the Cannibals in the 1970s. When the Cannibals disbanded Ray founded [[Stimela (music band)|Stimela]], with whom he conceived gold and platinum-selling albums like ''Fire, Passion and {{sic|?|hide=y|Ecs|tacy}}'' (1984), ''Look, Listen and Decide'' (1986). He collaborated with [[Paul Simon]] and [[Ladysmith Black Mambazo]] on Simon's ''[[Graceland (album)|
Graceland]]'' (1986) album.
